titles.title: To amend title 44, United States Code, to transfer to the Public Printer the authority over the individuals responsible for preparing indexes of the Congressional Record, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Mr. Ney moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3229.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 10/29/2003--Public Law. Amends Federal law to transfer from the Joint Committee on Printing to the Public Printer authority over the individuals responsible for preparing indexes of the Congressional Record. (Currently the Joint Committee designates to the Public Printer competent persons who are employees of the Congressional Record Index Office.) Transfers employees of the Congressional Record Index Office (as well as their accrued annual and sick leave) to the Government Printing Office.
